alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:50PM EDT until July 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe and Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM EDT, Runoff from earlier thunderstorms will continue this evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dugger Creek, Darnell Creek, Cane Creek, Bee Tree Branch, Camp Branch, Cub Creek, East Prong Roaring River, Bussels Creek, Church Branch, Clear Branch, East Swan Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek and Dobbins Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Ronda... Mc Grady... Wilbar... Glendale Springs... Fairplains... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
